    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the system to its start state.

      • cloneState

        @ByVal
public ALEState cloneState(@Cast(value="bool")
                                  boolean include_rng)
        Returns a copy of the current environment state. Note that by default this **does** include the PNRG for sticky actions. You can optionally include the PRNG by setting include_rng to true. For planning you probably want to disable sticky actions. The emulator is fully deterministic.

      • cloneState

        @ByVal
public ALEState cloneState()

      • restoreState

        public void restoreState(@Const @ByRef
                         ALEState arg0)
        Restores a previously saved copy of the state.

      • act

        @Cast(value="ale::reward_t")
public int act(@Cast(value="ale::Action")
                                            int player_a_action,
                                            @Cast(value="ale::Action")
                                            int player_b_action)
        Applies the given actions (e.g. updating paddle positions when the paddle is used) and performs one simulation step in Stella. Returns the resultant reward. When frame skip is set to > 1, up the corresponding number of simulation steps are performed. Note that the post-act() frame number might not correspond to the pre-act() frame number plus the frame skip.

      • softReset

        public void softReset()
        This functions emulates a push on the reset button of the console

      • pressSelect

        public void pressSelect(@Cast(value="size_t")
                        long num_steps)
        Keep pressing the console select button for a given amount of time

      • pressSelect

        public void pressSelect()

      • setDifficulty

        public void setDifficulty(@Cast(value="ale::difficulty_t")
                          int value)
        Set the difficulty according to the value. If the first bit is 1, then it will put the left difficulty switch to A (otherwise leave it on B) If the second bit is 1, then it will put the right difficulty switch to A (otherwise leave it on B) This change takes effect at the immediate next time step.

      • setMode

        public void setMode(@Cast(value="ale::game_mode_t")
                    int value)
        Set the game mode according to the value. The new mode will not take effect until reset() is called

      • isTerminal

        @Cast(value="bool")
public boolean isTerminal()
        Returns true if the ROM reported a terminal signal OR if the episode is truncated (i.e., isGameTerminal() || isTruncated()). This functions serves to be backwards compatible with previous versions of ALE.

      • isGameTerminal

        @Cast(value="bool")
public boolean isGameTerminal()
        Returns true if the ROM reported a terminal signal

      • isGameTruncated

        @Cast(value="bool")
public boolean isGameTruncated()
        Returns true if the episode is truncated, i.e., max number of frames is reached

      • setState

        public void setState(@Const @ByRef
                     ALEState state)
        Accessor methods for the environment state.

        @Const
 @ByRef
public ALEState getState()

        @Const
 @ByRef
public ALEScreen getScreen()
        Returns the current screen after processing (e.g. colour averaging)

      • setRAM

        public void setRAM(@Cast(value="size_t")
                   long memory_index,
                   @Cast(value="ale::byte_t")
                   byte value)
        Accessor methods for RAM. setRAM can be useful to alter the environment. For example, learning a causal model of RAM transitions, changing environment dynamics, etc.
